thread.section_title: Caltrans Quickly Cleans Up Mudslide On I-80 In Sierra – CBS Sacramento
thread.title: Caltrans Quickly Cleans Up Mudslide On I-80 In Sierra
thread.title_full: Caltrans Quickly Cleans Up Mudslide On I-80 In Sierra

author: Cecilio Padilla
title: Caltrans Quickly Cleans Up Mudslide On I-80 In Sierra
text:
TRUCKEE (CBS13) – It looks bad, but Caltrans crews were well-prepared and were able to keep a mudslide from affecting traffic in the high Sierra for long.
The scene was on westbound Interstate 80, east of Donner Lake Road.
California Highway Patrol’s Truckee division says the mudslide came down and blocked the roadway.
However, thanks to quick work from Caltrans, the mess was cleaned up quickly and traffic was only briefly affected.
The fun continues!
This mudslide came down I-80 westbound, east of Donner Lake Rd. Only briefly affected… https://t.co/cdtqqs85Lc 
— CHP-Truckee (@CHP_Truckee) January 8, 2017 

Caltrans crews have been busy up and down Sierra and Valley roadways cleaning up messes left by the storm that rolled through.
Head Here For The Latest Roadway Conditions From Around The Region 
Flood warnings and watches remain in effect, while a severe avalanche danger warning is in effect for the Sierra.
